content.title: AV Fistula Maturation
content.definition: The process by which a newly created arteriovenous fistula develops adequate size, flow, and wall thickness to allow successful hemodialysis cannulation.

clinical_features.dilation: Venous dilation from increased flow and wall stress
clinical_features.wall_thickening: Arterialization of vein wall (smooth muscle hypertrophy)
clinical_features.timeline: Typically 4-8 weeks for radiocephalic, 4-6 weeks for upper arm

clinical_features.length: At least 6cm usable length for cannulation

concepts.definition: Fistula that does not meet maturation criteria.

clinical_features.risk_factors: Female sex, diabetes, small vessels, obesity
clinical_features.causes: Inflow stenosis, juxta-anastomotic stenosis, accessory veins

clinical_features.angioplasty: Balloon dilation of stenosis (most common intervention)

content.statement: AV Fistula Maturation is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Dialysis-Access that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.
